title: App creator sues officials over removal of ICEBlock app
snippets: The Trump administration has accused ICEBlock of making federal agents vulnerable to attack and called for its removal.
The app lets people anonymously share the locations of immigration agents but Apple removed it from its app store under pressure from the Trump administration. Now, the app's developer is suing.

Joshua Aaron, the developer of the ICEBlock app, is suing Attorney General Pam Bondi, US Homeland Security Secretary Kirsti Noem, acting director of ICE Todd Lyons, White House "Border Czar" Tom Homan, and other federal officials over the Trump administration's "unlawful threats" made against Aaron

summary: Joshua Aaron, developer of the ICEBlock app, has filed a lawsuit against several federal officials, including Attorney General Pam Bondi and Homeland Security Secretary Kirsti Noem. The suit alleges that the Trump administration unlawfully pressured Apple to remove the app, which allowed users to share the locations of immigration agents, violating Aaron's free speech rights. The case is ongoing.

title: Dylan Harper helps Spurs beat Pelicans with late basket
snippets: Dylan Harper came out on top in a clash of 2025 rookies despite Pelicans center Derik Queen's 33-point triple-double in a thrilling 135-132 Spurs win.

Harrison Barnes scored 24 points, rookie Dylan Harper capped a 22-point performance with a go-ahead driving floater with nine seconds left, and the San Antonio Spurs recovered from losing a 20-point halftime lead to beat the reeling New Orleans Pelicans 135-132 on Monday night.
titles: Harper spoils Queen's triple-double in rookie clash
Spurs spoil Derik Queen’s first triple-double to hold off Pelicans
summary: Rookie Dylan Harper scored 22 points, including a decisive floater with nine seconds remaining, as the San Antonio Spurs defeated the New Orleans Pelicans 135-132. Despite Pelicans center Derik Queen recording a 33-point triple-double, the Spurs overcame a lost 20-point halftime lead to secure the win on December 8, 2025. Harrison Barnes added 24 points for the Spurs.

title: Chargers win in overtime against Eagles with late interception
snippets: Highlights from the Week 14 matchup between the Philadelphia Eagles and the Los Angeles Chargers during the 2025 NFL season.
Watch as Los Angeles Chargers defensive back Tony Jefferson comes up with a walk-off interception in overtime after Philadelphia Eagles quarterback Jalen Hurts had his pass deflected.

Cameron Dicker kicked a go-ahead 54-yard field goal — one of his five in the game — and Tony Jefferson intercepted Jalen Hurts at the one-yard line, lifting the Los Angeles Chargers to a 22-19 victory over the slumping Philadelphia Eagles in a messy game for both teams.
titles: Highlights: Chargers seal win over Eagles with interception in OT!

Chargers walk off Eagles in overtime on Hurts’ fourth interception
summary: The Los Angeles Chargers defeated the Philadelphia Eagles 22-19 in overtime during Week 14 of the 2025 NFL season. Cameron Dicker made five field goals, including a 54-yarder in overtime. Tony Jefferson secured the win for the Chargers by intercepting a deflected Jalen Hurts pass at the one-yard line, ending the game.
